channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Use time to better prepare teachers, students, DepEd told
item.description: Sen. Bong Go has urged the Department of Education and other stakeholders to use the time brought about by the postponement of opening school year 2020-2021 to develop and further improve flexible distance learning programs to avoid putting unnecessary burden on students and teachers still struggling to adapt to new modes of learning and teaching.

item.title: Fuel prices up today
item.author: Catherine Talavera
item.description: Oil companies are imposing increases in the prices of diesel and gasoline today, but no changes for kerosene.

item.title: LPA brings rains to Northern Luzon — PAGASA
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: The state weather bureau yesterday advised residents of Northern Luzon to brace for possible flooding and landslide due to rains brought by a low-pressure area.

item.title: Navy’s first missile-capable warship to be tested in Hawaii
item.author: Michael Punongbayan
item.description: The warfare capabilities of the Philippine Navy’s new and very first missile-capable warship will be tested at the 2020 Rim of the Pacific naval exercise that began yesterday in Hawaii, USA.

item.title: Remittances hit 5-month high in June – BSP
item.author: Lawrence Agcaoili
item.description: The Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas said remittances rebounded and grew over seven percent to a five-month high in June, ending three consecutive months of decline as more displaced overseas Filipino workers were repatriated amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: DOT to give Bayanihan 2 funds to stakeholders
item.author: Catherine Talavera
item.description: Tourism Secretary Bernadette Romulo-Puyat said the Department of Tourism remains firm on its commitment to allocate funds for the financial assistance of tourism stakeholders under the Bayanihan 2 bill.

item.title: Local scientists report new strain of COVID-19
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: A new strain of coronavirus disease believed to be more infectious than SARS-CoV-2, the virus causing COVID-19, has been found in the country, a report by the Philippine Genome Center showed.

item.title: Palace to ask PNP chief about Baguio dinner
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Malacañang will ask Philippine National Police chief General Archie Gamboa to shed light on the gathering of police officials in Baguio City, which was held as quarantine measures are being enforced to contain the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Project ARK launches pooled COVID-19 testing
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: The private sector, in partnership with local government units in Metro Manila, is set to begin implementing the pooled polymerase chain reaction tests in groups of five individuals.

item.title: House suspends sessions as COVID-positive employees increase
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: The House of Representatives under the leadership of Speaker Alan Peter Cayetano has decided to suspend the chamber’s sessions temporarily as cases of employees being infected by the coronavirus disease 2019 have reached 44 since mid-March.
